Physical health, on the other hand, focuses on the body and its functions. This includes aspects like nutrition, exercise, disease prevention, treatment, and recovery from illness or injury. Physical health care encompasses services such as healthcare check-ups, medical treatments, surgery, and rehabilitation. 

Both mental and physical health are interconnected; they influence each other and impact overall quality of life. For example, stress and anxiety can affect both mental and physical health, while regular exercise and healthy eating can improve both. 

Ensuring equal access to mental and physical health care is vital because it ensures that everyone has the opportunity to maintain and improve their well-being. Unfortunately, there are still disparities and inequalities in healthcare
